results.title: Daybreak in Udi
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: The Abaja Ibos, with the advice of the District Officer, in the Udi division of Nigeria, build a maternity home and show how ancient prejudices are overcome in the development of their territory.

results.title: Danzon
results.creator_credit: Maria Novaro, Jorge Sanchez, Television Espanola, Tabasco Films and Instituto Mexicano de Cinematografia
results.brief_description: A light-hearted romantic tale about thirty-something Julia (Maria Rojo), a telephone operator and single mother of a 15-year-old daughter living in Mexico City whose passion is dancing the “danzon”, a ballroom dance with its origins in Haiti and which spread across to Cuba during the mid-1800s, finally finding its way to Mexico several years later. Mexico in fact celebrated the 100th anniversary of the danzon in the 1990s. Sensual and seductive, danzon expresses the unspoken relationship which exists between the dancing partners, where “the man commands and the woman obeys; the man seduces and the woman shines” and for Julia, when Carmelo (Daniel Rergis), her suave and elegant dancing partner of ten years, mysteriously disappears one night, life suddenly becomes meaningless. Julia sets out determinedly to find Carmelo, following a trail of clues to Vera Cruz where she encounters an eclectic mix of new friends including a motherly hotel manager with an acerbic tongue, a prostitute with a young baby, and a transvestite named Susy (Tito Vasconcelos). This journey of self-discovery, of old loves and new loves, twists and turns gently to the tune of the rhythmic Mexican music and the sensually tantalising dancing of the danzon. Maria Novaro (Lola, 1989) is one of Mexico’s most successful women film directors and is not only renowned for her feminist approach but is also considered an “expressionist” director for the use of colors as an important feature in her filmmaking. “Danzon” appeared in the Cannes Film Festival Official Selection for 1991. Cast also includes Carmen Salinas, Margarita Isabel, Victor Carpinteiro, Cheli Godinez. Original music by Agustin Lara, Pepe Luis, Felipe Perez, Consuelo Velazquez.

results.title: Danish design
results.creator_credit: Danish Society of Arts and Crafts and Independent Designers and Brandon Films
results.brief_description: Danish contemporary art and design. Examples of the best known furniture designers, fabrics, silverware and kitchen utensils, illustrate Danish functionalism inspired by craft traditions, art and culture of other countries. A skilled craftsman is shown making a chair.

results.title: Culloden
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of the Battle of Culloden, fought in 1746 between the Scottish Jacobites and an English force led by the Duke of Cumberland. In this film, the director utilises a television reportage style to recreate and analyse the battle.
results.description: A dramatic reconstruction of the Battle of Culloden, fought in 1746 between the Scottish Jacobites and an English force led by the Duke of Cumberland. In this film, the director utilises a television reportage style to recreate and analyse the battle.

results.title: Cul-de-Sac
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Gene Gutowski and Compton
results.brief_description: Two wounded gangsters on the run descend upon a retired businessman living like a hermit with his young, bored and flirtatious French wife in an old castle on Holy Island, off the Northumberland coast. The arrival of the gangsters disrupts the couple’s eccentric relationship. (Awards: Winner of the Golden Bear at the Berlin Film Festival, 1966) Cast includes Donald Pleasence, Francoise Dorleac, Jacqueline Bisset, Lionel Stander and Jack MacGowran.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee II
results.creator_credit: John Cornell, Jane Scott and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Begins in New York where Dundee now lives with his journalist girlfriend. In order to escape the pursuit of an international drug ring who have murdered her former husband, Dundee and his girlfriend return to the Australian outback where Dundee is well prepared to confront them.

results.title: Covered Wagon
results.creator_credit: James Cruze and Famous Players-Lasky Corporation
results.brief_description: Recounts the journey by the men and women who left the Mississippi and Ohio valleys in 1848 to migrate to Oregon. Most of this Western epic was shot on location and captures the beauty of America’s vast frontier landscape. Essentially a romantic drama focusing on the leader of a wagon train who falls in love with the daughter of another wagon train leader. Before he can win her heart, he must clear himself of false cattle theft charges. During the journey, the wagon trains are exposed to forces of nature and the wrath of native Americans Indians defending their land against intruders. Script by Jack Cunningham based on the novel by Emerson Hough. Photographed by Karl Brown. Edited by Dorothy Arzner. Starring Alan Hale, J. Warren Kerrigan, Charles Ogle and Lois Wilson. Based on the novel by Emerson Hough.

results.title: Clockers
results.creator_credit: Spike Lee, Jon Kilik, Martin Scorsese, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: An evocative and hard-hitting story of a drug run urban battlefield where Strike (Mekhi Phifer), a 24-hour drug dealer known as a ‘clocker’, finds that his time of success on the street is running out. Nursing an ulcer and spending his spare time playing with model trains and hanging around with his brothers outside the project houses, one day Strike is given a tip off by the local drug lord, Rodney, for what seems to be an opportunity for advancement. However, when a rival dealer ends up dead and his own law-abiding brother confesses to the murder he finds himself caught between two homicide detectives, only one of whom is concerned about the truth, and the wrath and cover ups of his street-wise colleagues. This film poignantly explores the complex machinations of a neighbourhood spiraling out of control where few can be credited with looking after anyone but themselves. Layered with issues of social and racial upheaval and prejudice and the evocation of the qualities and disparities of human behaviour this is another example of powerful filmmaking from director, Spike Lee.

results.title: Cloak and dagger
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Milton Sperling and United States Pictures
results.brief_description: Gary Cooper is an American science professor, parachuted into war torn Nazi Germany to obtain military secrets. The deeper he probes, the deadlier his mission becomes, especially when his involvement with the mysterious Gina (Lilli Palmer) catapults him into a whirlpool of danger, betrayal and murder.

results.title: Clara Gibbings
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This production was adapted from the play of the same name and remained basically a filmed stage play. Dorothy Brunton plays Clara Gibbings, the proprietor of a London pub, who discovers that she is the legitimate but abandoned daughter of the Earl of Dunmoor. She launches herself into high society but soon grows disillusioned and decides to return to the fresh air of her own class. A young aristocrat, Errol, has meanwhile learnt to respect Clara and to see his own decadent life in a new light. Impulsively he proposes marriage and they depart for Australia.
